mdx.excerpt: Welcome, it's great to have you here. We know that first impressions are important, so we've populated your new site with some initial getting started posts that will help you get familiar with everything in no time.

frontmatter.title: Welcome to Ghost
frontmatter.excerpt: Welcome, it's great to have you here. We know that first impressions are important, so we've populated your new site with some initial getting started posts that will help you get familiar with everything in no time.

node.excerpt: The SAM Pattern as an alternative approach to widely adopted Frontend architectures. I show how to implement a simple browser game with this pattern.
About asynchronous event handling with JavaScript and TypeScript. I'm showcasing the potential of rxjs with a very first and simple example which implements drag and drop.
I discovered an interesting movie about gender inequality in the tech-industry which I present and recommend here.
I pick up the Redux Architecture which I developed in my last two posts and show how to obtain a typization of the Redux hooks. For this, I introduce and explain discriminated union types.
I continue with the App which I created in my last post. I discuss different techniques that improve the structure of the React/Redux/TypeScript Architecture.

prev.excerpt: Ghost uses a language called  Markdown  to format text. When you go to edit a post and see special characters and colours intertwined…

next.excerpt: I show how to set up a react library which I publish to Github, so I can import it into a React project as a dependency. There is a powerful tool which allows to do a boilerplate approach to build a library: create-react-library.

frontmatter.title: Creating a React Library with TypeScript
frontmatter.excerpt: I show how to set up a react library which I publish to Github, so I can import it into a React project as a dependency. There is a powerful tool which allows to do a boilerplate approach to build a library: create-react-library.
